title: 'rustc' panicked at 'forcing query with already existing `DepNode`

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
### Code I don't have a minimal code example, but I ran into this by cloning bevy and trying to run an example. Steps to reproduce: Clone `git@github.com:bevyengine/bevy.git` Checkout commit `bc13d11c78c0593e6bce61b65ec3bfc1da7842df` Run `cargo run --example breakout` ### Meta `rustc --version --verbose`: ``` rustc 1.50.0-nightly (6645da366 2020-12-01) binary: rustc commit-hash: 6645da366eed0c61258a04265bea513e94df7ea6 commit-date: 2020-12-01 host: x86_64-apple-darwin release: 1.50.0-nightly ``` ### Error output ``` Compiling bevy_ecs v0.5.0 (/Users/ryanm/Code/bevy/crates/bevy_ecs) Compiling coreaudio-rs v0.10.0 Compiling wgpu v0.7.1 thread 'rustc' panicked at 'forcing query with already existing `DepNode` - query-key: (DefId(0:448 ~ bevy_ecs[51b0]::query::fetch::Fetch), Some(Item#161)) - dep-node: super_predicates_that_define_assoc_type(1e830c8fa7a25bb3-734c91de3f9d061a)', /rustc/6645da366eed0c61258a04265bea513e94df7ea6/compiler/rustc_query_system/src/query/plumbing.rs:586:5 note: run with `RUST_BACKTRACE=1` environment variable to display a backtrace error: internal compiler error: unexpected panic note: the compiler unexpectedly panicked. this is a bug. note: we would appreciate a bug report: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/new?labels=C-bug%2C+I-ICE%2C+T-compiler&template=ice.md note: rustc 1.50.0-nightly (6645da366 2020-12-01) running on x86_64-apple-darwin note: compiler flags: -C embed-bitcode=no -C debuginfo=2 -C incremental --crate-type lib note: some of the compiler flags provided by cargo are hidden query stack during panic: #0 [type_of] computing type of `<(F0, F1) as query::fetch::Fetch<'a>>::Item` #1 [collect_mod_item_types] collecting item types in module `query::fetch` end of query stack ```
Backtrace

``` Compiling bevy_ecs v0.5.0 (/Users/ryanm/Code/bevy/crates/bevy_ecs) Compiling cpal v0.13.3 Compiling rodio v0.13.1 thread 'rustc' panicked at 'forcing query with already existing `DepNode` - query-key: (DefId(0:448 ~ bevy_ecs[51b0]::query::fetch::Fetch), Some(Item#161)) - dep-node: super_predicates_that_define_assoc_type(1e830c8fa7a25bb3-734c91de3f9d061a)', /rustc/6645da366eed0c61258a04265bea513e94df7ea6/compiler/rustc_query_system/src/query/plumbing.rs:586:5 stack backtrace: 0: _rust_begin_unwind 1: std::panicking::begin_panic_fmt 2: rustc_query_system::query::plumbing::get_query_impl 3: rustc_infer::traits::util::transitive_bounds_that_define_assoc_type 4: ::associated_path_to_ty 5: ::ast_ty_to_ty_inner 6: as core::iter::traits::collect::Extend<::Item>>::extend 7: >::intern_with 8: ::ast_ty_to_ty_inner 9: rustc_typeck::collect::type_of::type_of 10: rustc_middle::ty::query:: for rustc_middle::ty::query::queries::type_of>::compute 11: rustc_middle::dep_graph::::with_deps 12: rustc_query_system::dep_graph::graph::DepGraph::with_task 13: rustc_data_structures::stack::ensure_sufficient_stack 14: rustc_query_system::query::plumbing::get_query_impl 15: rustc_query_system::query::plumbing::ensure_query_impl 16: ::visit_impl_item 17: rustc_middle::hir::map::Map::visit_item_likes_in_module 18: rustc_typeck::collect::collect_mod_item_types 19: rustc_middle::ty::query:: for rustc_middle::ty::query::queries::collect_mod_item_types>::compute 20: rustc_middle::dep_graph::::with_deps 21: rustc_query_system::dep_graph::graph::DepGraph::with_task 22: rustc_data_structures::stack::ensure_sufficient_stack 23: rustc_query_system::query::plumbing::get_query_impl 24: rustc_query_system::query::plumbing::ensure_query_impl 25: rustc_session::session::Session::track_errors 26: rustc_typeck::check_crate 27: rustc_interface::passes::analysis 28: rustc_middle::ty::query:: for rustc_middle::ty::query::queries::analysis>::compute 29: rustc_middle::dep_graph::::with_deps 30: rustc_query_system::dep_graph::graph::DepGraph::with_eval_always_task 31: rustc_data_structures::stack::ensure_sufficient_stack 32: rustc_query_system::query::plumbing::get_query_impl 33: rustc_interface::passes::QueryContext::enter 34: rustc_interface::queries::::enter 35: rustc_span::with_source_map 36: scoped_tls::ScopedKey::set note: Some details are omitted, run with `RUST_BACKTRACE=full` for a verbose backtrace. error: internal compiler error: unexpected panic note: the compiler unexpectedly panicked. this is a bug. note: we would appreciate a bug report: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/new?labels=C-bug%2C+I-ICE%2C+T-compiler&template=ice.md note: rustc 1.50.0-nightly (6645da366 2020-12-01) running on x86_64-apple-darwin note: compiler flags: -C embed-bitcode=no -C debuginfo=2 -C incremental --crate-type lib note: some of the compiler flags provided by cargo are hidden query stack during panic: #0 [type_of] computing type of `<(F0, F1) as query::fetch::Fetch<'a>>::Item` #1 [collect_mod_item_types] collecting item types in module `query::fetch` #2 [analysis] running analysis passes on this crate end of query stack error: could not compile `bevy_ecs` To learn more, run the command again with --verbose. warning: build failed, waiting for other jobs to finish... error: build failed ```
